title: Night Fill Team Member - Woolworths Epping North
description:
**Night Fill Team Member**
--------------------------

  

Starting in the afternoons or evenings, your work in restocking our shelves is vital in keeping the store ticking and our customers happy. Regular use of store equipment including pallet jacks, cutting tools, PPE for cold areas as required will be tools provided to support you in delivering a great offer to our customers.  



**Woolworths, a job is never just a job.**
------------------------------------------

  

It’s the start of something bigger. There are over 128,000 of us, in the biggest cities and the tiniest towns. And each of us have an important role to play. If you have a passion for great customer service, a hunger to make a tangible difference and you’re looking for a place to develop, you could be who we’re looking for.  



**Who we are**
--------------

  

Joining Woolworths Supermarkets means being a part of the wider Woolworths Group, which includes the businesses of Big W and Countdown (NZ). Which means you won’t have one opportunity with us, you’ll have thousands.  



**Why work with us**
--------------------

Whether you’re starting out, already on the way to achieving your goals or at the top of your game, we can help you build a brilliant retail career: If you’ve got goals, we’ve got all you need to succeed. You’ll find over a thousand career options, plus the learning encouragement and support for you to grow. We’re a team that is there for each other. By working alongside people you can learn from, you’ll grow and develop in a fun, supportive environment. Working with a diverse range of people in an industry facing rapid change, you’ll gain real-world experience and grow as a person. Whether it’s making customers smile, supporting Aussie farmers, or playing an important role in your local community, you’ll be doing a little good every day at Woolworths.  



**When you will be needed**
---------------------------

  

Wednesday Late Evening (6pm - Midnight), Saturday Late Evening (6pm - Midnight) and Monday Late Evening (6pm - Midnight) .  



**What makes you right for Woolies**
------------------------------------

  

**The right attitude is everything....**  

* Genuine passion for food & shopping
* Customer first mentality
* Love of teamwork and growing with others
* Flexible and adaptable to change
* Willing to work and reliable
**Grow with the Group**  



As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  

  



We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.

title: Shift Manager - Night Shift
description:
Wesfarmers Health was formed in March 2022, with the acquisition of Australian Pharmaceutical Industries (API). Our supporting portfolio of brands includes Priceline, Priceline Pharmacy, Soul Pattinson Chemist, Pharmacist Advice, Clear Skincare Clinics, InstantScripts and SILK Laser Clinics.  



**About us:**

Since our humble beginnings in 1910, we’ve grown from a small co-operative of three pharmacies to a national organisation and one of Australia’s leading health, beauty, and wellness companies.  



Wesfarmers Health includes 73 company-owned Priceline stores, 396 Priceline pharmacy franchise stores and 89 Clear Skincare clinics and is also a wholesale distributor of pharmaceutical goods. In 2023, the Health division expanded its digital and medical aesthetics offering with the acquisitions of telehealth provider InstantScripts, as well as the SILK Group, who operates a network of around 140 wholly-owned, joint venture and franchised clinics. The division employs more than 3600 team members.  



**About the role:**

As the Shift Manager, you’ll be working the night shift from 10pm to 6am, where you will play a pivotal role in ensuring our distribution centre located in Dandenong operates smoothly, safely, and efficiently during the night shift.  



Reporting to the Operations Manager, as the Shift Manager, you’ll lead a team of Team Managers and Labour Hire staff to ensure seamless and efficient distribution of our products. You’ll also be responsible for maintaining safety standards, managing KPIs, and ensuring we meet our business goals.  



This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced leader to step into a key role, where no two nights are the same!  



Key Responsibilities:


* Lead by example, ensuring compliance with health, safety, and wellbeing policies.
* Manage risk and develop processes to ensure the safe, smooth operation of the shift.
* Achieve operational KPIs, including financial, safety, and compliance metrics.
* Build and maintain an engaged team, promoting a positive work culture.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and external partners to drive customer-focused outcomes.  
* 

**What’s in it for you?**

* **Make a difference** by driving the health, safety, and wellbeing of our teams.
* **Leadership growth** with an opportunity to mentor, develop, and shape your own team.
* Be at the heart of **operational excellence** , collaborating with internal and external stakeholders.
* Contribute to **continuous improvement** and help shape the future of our supply chain.

**What you’ll bring:**

* 5+ years of leadership experience in FMCG or a similar fast-paced environment.
* Strong decision-making skills, using data and insights to identify and solve problems.
* Proactive leadership style. You are someone who drives change and fosters continuous improvement.
* Excellent communication skills, able to motivate and guide a diverse team.
A commitment to building team capability and ensuring successful succession planning.  
* 

**Why You'll Love Working with Us:**  



* A fantastic work culture based off our four Ways of Working – Start with the customer, Do it with heart, Work as a team, Own your impact.
* Flexible working that is balanced with our organisational need to create connections and enable collaboration.
* Ongoing professional development and career opportunities across the Wesfarmers Health Division and the broader Wesfarmers Group.
* Access to employee benefits across Wesfarmers including team member discounts at Bunnings, Kmart, Target, Officeworks, OnePass, Priceline and Clear Skincare Clinics.
* ‘We Love Your Work’ recognition program. Team members can recognise their peers, team or other business units, with winners taking part in our annual awards.
* Novated leasing options
* Access to our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) - available to all team members and their immediate family members, 24/7, 365 days a year.
* Beautiful outdoor terrace for work and recreation.
* Food, coffee and health & wellbeing facilities onsite including a landlord operated gym
Dedicated end of trip facilities (cycle racks, showers, lockers).  
* 

This is an opportunity to join a highly regarded and established company offering excellent career prospects and team member benefits. Wesfarmers Health is also committed to supporting the Workplace Gender Equality Agency requirements. For more information about Wesfarmers Health please visit wesfarmers.com.au/our-businesses/wesfarmers-health.  



**Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants**

*Wesfarmers Health aims to become an employer of choice for First Nations Australians, through investments that attract, empower and retain First Nations team members within our stores, distribution centres, clinics and corporate offices. As part of the Wesfarmers group, we provide authentic support through a diverse range of programs and initiatives, designed to empower you on your journey towards personal achievement and professional advancement.*

We believe in building direct connections with potential team members, fostering a deep understanding of their skills, and aligning them with our unique organizational culture.**

title: Personal Care Worker
description:
**About Us**

  

For over 40 years, CraigCare has been delivering clinical and relationship-based care that connects and enriches the lives of all of our residents, every single day.

  

Our Vision is for older people to be connected to their community through wellness and excellent customer service.

  

Our Mission is to care for our residents in a manner which enhances their quality of life within the community that they belong. We achieve this by providing the highest standard of aged care at all times which is delivered with honesty, warmth and respect.

  

Our values guide everything we do on a daily basis and it is these values that makes CraigCare the trusted aged care provider it is today.

 **About the role**

  

We are seeking Personal Care Workers for our **CraigCare Moonee Ponds** home on a **Part time basis doing Night shifts.** As a Personal Care Worker, you will work under the guidance of our Registered Nurses, assisting our residents with their daily living activities to enhance their well-being and ensure care delivery is to the highest standard.

  

The Personal Care Worker role is part of an integrated team of professionals who work within an agreed clinical care framework to provide personalised care to our residents. This role is vital in ensuring we maintain high-quality care and high quality of life for our residents at all times.

 **Essential Requirements:**

* Effective written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong understanding of Aged Care Quality Standards, Aged Care Act and Quality of Care Principles
* Reliability to work to a roster with set shifts and basic computer skills
* Working knowledge of WH&S and infection control.
* Certificate III in Aged Care /Individual Support (or currently working towards).
* Previous work experience within the aged care sector is preferred but not essential.
* You would also need to have a current NDIS clearance, proof of Rights to Work, and a current immunisation certificate (including influenza and vaccination against COVID-19, including booster).

**Key Responsibilities**

* Support residents in living the life they choose by allowing them to exercise choice and independence.
* Contribute to the overall quality of life of the residents (physical, emotional and lifestyle interests).
* Implement clinical and care interventions delegated by the Registered Nurses, and as documented in the resident's care plan.
* Assist residents with their personal care and hygiene needs while encouraging their independence.
* Ability to prioritise workloads effectively and deliver care with decency and compassion.
* Kindness and patience with residents are essential, as is respect for their individual needs. You must also respect their privacy, dignity, choice, and self-esteem.
* Commitment to continuous quality improvement.

**Culture and Benefits**

 **Learning & development**. With over 40 years’ experience, we have created a culture and environment for our staff to learn and grow with opportunity of ongoing professional development.

 **Wellness Program**. This includes a comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, free to all employees and their families and free flu vaccinations each year.

 **Flexible Rosters.** We understand and value the importance of work life balance. We offer flexible rosters to assist your work-life balance**.**

 **Remuneration and discounts**. We offer a generous remuneration package. You can also take advantage of financial discount across major retail, hospitality and health outlets.

 **Free Parking**. There is free parking in our secure undercover carpark.

  

At CraigCare, we understand the immense value a diverse workforce brings to our organisation. We believe in creating an environment where individuals can feel comfortable being their authentic selves, and where everyone is respected and celebrated equally. We strongly encourage applications from individuals of all ages, genders, abilities, cultural backgrounds, and linguistic backgrounds, as well as from Indigenous Australians.

 **Care to Join Us?**


Please apply now by clicking the **"Apply for this job"** button.

  

Please note that only short-listed applicants will be contacted.

title: 2 x Network Coordinators
description:
Lineage is the world's largest temperature-controlled industrial REIT and logistics solutions provider, with a global network of over 400 facilities, spanning 25 countries across North & South America, Europe and Asia-Pacific.


Working a Lineage is not just a job - it's an opportunity to innovate and put your mark on how food moves from the farm to dinner tables around the world. As a member of the Lineage team, you are a critical link in the food supply chain.


The Asia-Pacific region currently includes Australia, New Zealand, Vietnam, Sri Lanka and Singapore employing nearly 3000 team members.

**As we continue our transformation and growth journey in the region, we are now looking to appoint 2 x Network Coordinators for night-shift transport operations at our Hume Road facility in Laverton North.**


The purpose of these roles is to provide after-hours support for the National Linehaul operations and execute the strategy for Lineage Logistics Australia delivering the business' requirements in terms of product, delivery and service whilst managing to commercial targets.


This is achieved through fostering a flexible work team approach which focuses on efficiency, waste reduction, quality, compliance, safety, continuous improvement whilst meeting and exceeding business expectations.


Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

* Managing Road Linehaul schedules and freight routing
* Proactively identifying Linehaul performance gaps and initiating corrective actions and processes
* Supporting the incident reporting process
* Administering & controlling the non-conformance management system
* Assisting management of road & rail Linehaul suppliers including development of Approved supplier.
* Linehaul cost expenditure analysis & reporting
* Ensuring responsibilities are met as set out in the framework documents for OH&S, Environment, Quality and Safety
* Ensuring compliance with statutory OH&S Legislation.
* Ensure compliance with Dangerous Goods Legislation.

 **Skills and experience/qualifications will ideally include:**


* Experience in a similar role (preferred coming from High Volume Linehaul Operations)
* Refrigerated Transport experience is desired but not essential, including operations/servicing the Food Manufacturers (FMCG)
* Qualifications in Supply Chain, Logistics or management

 **Why are these opportunities exciting?**  



As a values-based business, we are proud to offer you a respectful work environment built around trust, collaboration and support. This means we will do everything in our power to set you up for long-term success.


In addition, these roles will afford you with the opportunity to make a positive impact on our team ensuring we remain a great place to work.


You will also work as part of a national team with a great depth of experience, so you can look forward to learning from the best in the industry and further developing your linehaul and transport coordination skills with global business recognised for innovation and expertise.


Why Lineage?

  

Lineage is more than just a cold storage logistics business. We're focused on being a vibrant, innovative and progressive employer where all our teams work safely, harmoniously and efficiently toward a common purpose - transforming the food supply chain to eliminate waste and help feed the world.


Lineage is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic work environment and encourages applicants from all backgrounds to apply.
